Pre-Game Insights: Scotland's head coach Steve Clarke said he'd instilled in his team the mantra 'respect everyone and fear no one' and expressed confidence in his team's ability to deliver as they aim to qualify for the knockout stages of a major tournament for the first time.
Scotland captain Andy Robertson acknowledged the challenge of the opening match but expressed gratitude to the Tartan Army for their support, hoping to give them plenty to cheer about.
Germany captain İlkay Gündoğan emphasized the importance of a convincing start to build momentum and euphoria for the subsequent games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Scottish fans are out in droves in Munich, proudly wearing their team jerseys, while there is hardly a German top or flag to be seen.

Germany went out at the group stage of both the previous World Cups and was eliminated by England in the round of 16 at Euro 2020, adding pressure on the home nation which is the clear favorite in the opener.
